sub_title: Bridge Builder in the Quantum Ecosystem in the Netherlands
summary:
Moonshots and return-on-investment are not mutually exclusive!
It is my conviction that foundational research can truly be a source for innovation that leads to positive societal impact and economic growth. 

I love shaping multidisciplinary open-innovation programs and excel at bringing researchers, engineers, domain specialists and end users from industry, governmental and societal organization together around a common interest to invest in the power of disruptive technologies. Currently, my focus is on quantum technologies.

My core interest is in bringing ideas and concepts to the level of strategies and actions and into coherent programs, all the while keeping the anticipated impact as a guiding principle. I want to bring such new programs to a mature level, so that everyone understands what needs to be done to execute the program towards the expected deliverables and the foreseen impact. Doing this with the bright and enthused people I meet every day is a thrill.

My 11+ years of experience in national funding agencies, universities (of technology), foundational research institutions and national research and innovation programs have given me an understanding of complex stakeholder management, funding mechanisms, negotiation and long-term strategizing that allow me to be effective, while close to a decade of foundational research experience keeps me grounded enough to understand what is real and to avoid chasing pipe dreams.

Let me know if you have such a Moonshot-like challenge towards a well-defined impact on the world!

projects.title: Roadmapteam Advanced Instrumentation - secretary
projects.description: Organizing and connecting the industrial and scientific community in the field of Advanced Instrumentation, building bridges, creating networks, aligning needs and ideas. Creating a spot for the field in the Topsector High Tech Systems and Materials and growing economy by lifting the whole value chain and increasing the export of high tech advanced instrumentation.

contributors.headline: Bridge Builder in the Quantum Ecosystem in the Netherlands

projects.title: Acceptatietest project administratiesysteem ISAAC
projects.description: Binnekort gaan alle NWO gebieden over op een nieuw (project-)administratie en beheersysteem: ISAAC. Dit najaar ben ik één van de acceptatietesters om te zien of dit systeem voor FOM efficient en intuitief werkt.

contributors.headline: Bridge Builder in the Quantum Ecosystem in the Netherlands

projects.title: High Tech Materials Call - Najaar 2013
projects.description:
This fall FOM, in conjunction with STW and M2i, runs the High Tech Materials call. I am responsible for setting up the call, providing the call documentation, informing and aiding applicants and coordinating the call procedures - including searching for international referees, involving the Program Committee and contacting the Chair of the Roadmap High Tech Materials.
 
The pre-announcement was launched September 30 2013, deadline for submission of proposals is December 2 2013. Final decision by the Executive Board of FOM is expected in May 2014.

contributors.headline: Bridge Builder in the Quantum Ecosystem in the Netherlands
Program Officer at Technology Foundation STW

projects.title: NWO Werkgroep IPR afspraken binnen PPS
projects.description: Doel van deze werkgroep is om NWO brede afspraken over intellectueel eigendom en de gebruiksrechten (IPR) hiervan vast te stellen. Hierbij draait het expliciet om Publiek-Private Samenwerkingsverbanden (PPS) in het kader van het topsectorenbeleid. Uiteindelijk zullen de door het Algemeen Bestuur van NWO geaccordeerde afspraken bij alle NWO calls toegepast worden.

projects.title: HTM Call Voorjaar 2015
projects.description:
This spring FOM, in conjunction with STW and M2i, runs the High Tech Materials call. I am responsible for setting up the call, providing the call documentation, informing and aiding applicants and coordinating the call procedures - including searching for international referees, involving the Program Committee and contacting the Chair of the Roadmap High Tech Materials.
 
The pre-announcement was launched March 16 2015, deadline for submission of proposals is June 8 2015. Final decision by the Executive Board of FOM is expected end 2015.

profile_positions.description:
* Member Executive Committee
* Contact for researchers participating in QAL projects.
* Reporting to Valorization Council CWI

* Helped secure 600.000€ from QDNL program for application development with private partners.
* Helped secure 100.000€ from the Startimpuls funding (Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate)
profile_positions.title: Executive Committee Quantum Application Lab

profile_positions.description:
* Coordination of 20 M€ Research and Innovation Program
* Strategic planning
* Budget planning
* Financial control and reporting
* Organization of program meetings and events
* Contact person
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Quantum & Society

profile_positions.description:
* Co-author of Groeifondsproposal Quantum Delta NL awarded 615 million € in 2021.
* Co-author of National Agenda Quantum Technology, awarded 23.5 million € in 2020.

* Member of Core Project Team.
* Lead in support for Action Line  4 (Quantum & Society)
* Lead in support for Centre for Quantum & Society.
* Member Taskforce Action Line 2 (Ecosystem Development).
* Member House of Quantum project team.
profile_positions.title: Member Core Team

profile_positions.description:
* Member of Management Team. 
* Advisor to the Directorate. 
* Liaison to the University of Amsterdam and Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (founding partners). 
* Team lead for Communication and Impact. 
* Talking point to researchers developing cutting edge quantum algorithm, software and applications research.
profile_positions.title: Institute Coordinator QuSoft

profile_positions.description:
Quantum.Amsterdam, founded by research center for quantum software QuSoft, is the gateway for companies to explore quantum software and applications.
Its mission is to prepare companies for the quantum future, to build awareness and provide guidance, to identify and validate use cases and to build strategic roadmaps. Quantum.Amsterdam is here to initiate Research & Development collaborations and strives to develop quantum applications to better society.

* Secured 307.000€ for funding the Q.A office spaces and the Quantum.Amsterdam Experience demo room, awarded by QDNL Growthfund program.
* Secured 5.000€ from CWI Valorization Fund for updating the Quantum Orb/Bloch Sphere demo for the Quantum.Amsterdam Experience.
* Led the Quantum.Amsterdam Experience development team until its opening on April 14 2023.
profile_positions.title: Team Member R&D coordination

profile_positions.description:
* Advising the steering and organizing committee of WIQD

WIQD (pronounced “wicked”) is a professional network for quantum technology enthusiasts from industry, academia and policy.

Our mission is to bring together women in quantum in the Netherlands, and beyond, for support, networking, and community growth.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Committee member "Women In Quantum Development" (WIQD)

profile_positions.description:
Assisting researchers in developing new reasearch ideas, identifying new funding opportunities, and connecting with external partners.

Stimulating cross-departmental, mutlidisciplinary collaboration.

Co-developer of plan for te launch of the Center for Quantum Materials and Technology Eindhoven (QT/e).

Advisor Collaboration and Strategy and member Management Team
Center for Quantum Materials and Technology Eindhoven.

Stimulating Photonics R&D&I activities as part of the Institute for Photonic Integration ecosystem, including the cross-over to quantum technology.

Advisor to the board of Department of Applied Physics on research activities with external partners, research funding, valorisation and strategy.

Member of the Research Support Network on behalf of the Department of Applied Physics.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer Department of Applied Physics

profile_positions.description:
FOM Industrial Partnership Programmes for the themes:
- Instrumentation
- Materials
- Optics
- Photonics

Secretary for 8 Industrial Partnership Programmes (Industrial Partners: HYET Solar, M2i, DPI/TIFN,SKF, Michelin, BASF, Fujifilm, FEI) - representing a total budget of appr. M€ 25.

Coordinator Physics With Industry 2015 workshop (50+ participants)

Coordinator Physics meets Industry event during Physics@FOM Veldhoven 2016 (100+ participants)

FOM is part of NWO

TKI-HTSM:
- Monitoring application for and use of TKI-supplement ('TKI-Toeslag')
- MIT-regulations (Innovation policies for SME's)
- Member Core Team 
- organization fall event

Roadmap Advanced Instrumentation of High Tech Systems and Materials 'Topsector':
- contact for public-private research development
profile_positions.title: Program Officer Research and Industry at FOM

profile_positions.description: Coordinating science policy in the Research Policy department at the Foundation for Fundamental Research on Matter (FOM). Responsibilities include: Facilitating FOM program and project leaders, coordinating policy in the field of Phenomenological Physics, Coordinating and Developing FOM Valorisation Policies, Facilitating the NWO/SURFsara/Vancis User Group and acting as NWO contact person for two Roadmaps in the HTSM topsector (Printing and Semiconductor Equipment) and as secretary for the Roadmap Advanced Instrumentation.
profile_positions.title: Program Officer

profile_positions.description:
Performing numerical and experimental research in the field of dusty plasma physics, including the topic of planet formation by charged dust aggregation. 

Teaching undergraduate physics and astronomy classes.

Managing NSF Research Experience for Undergraduates summer research project. 

Member of local organizing committee for 13th Workshop on the Physics of Dusty Plasmas (May 2012).
profile_positions.title: Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Experimental and numerical (Fluid modeling, N-body modeling, Particle-In-Cell/Monte Carlo modeling) studies of the charging and transport of particulates in low pressure plasmas.

Numerical modeling (N-body modeling, Particle-Particle, Particle-Cluster and Cluster-Cluster Agglomeration (PPA, PCA & CCA) modeling, Aggregate charging modeling) of dust aggregation in protoplanetary disks.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doctorate Research Associate

profile_positions.description: Studied plasma after-glow dynamics using Particle-In-Cell Plus Monte-Carlo techniques.
profile_positions.title: Junior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Implemented magnetic field effects in self-consistent two-dimensional dusty plasma fluid model.
Numerically investigated formation, sustainment and closure of voids in dusty plasma systems under microgravity conditions.
One-year member of the local and global FOM works-council ('Centrale Ondernemingsraad'), representing more than 150 (local) and over 1000 (global) FOM employees. Area specialty: young scientists.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

profile_positions.description:
Constructed Direct-Current dusty plasma setup with electro-magnet setup to study effect of magnetic field on plasma and dust transport.
Constructed Langmuir probe and emissive probe diagnostics.
Employed one-dimensional Particle-Image-Velocimetry setup and diagnostics software.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scientist

volunteer_experiences.description: Teaching adults and children about science in general and astronomy in particular by explaining their place in the universe and showing them the night sky. Guiding use of telescopes during weekend stargazing nights and providing tours through the museum.
